info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 2:08AM AKDT until September 20 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
Periods of moderate to heavy rain will fall across the Ketchikan area through early Saturday morning as an Atmospheric River remains focused on the southern panhandle.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Near Ketchikan.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 AM AKDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in Ketchikan with minor flooding ongoing. - Flooding will worsen through the night. - Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 24 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible through Saturday morning. - Greatest rainfall rates expected before 9 am.
- Wind gusts up to 30 mph early Saturday morning.
info.instruction:
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING
